publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3652 Kenny MacAskill: Borders, Citizenship and Immigration Bill - UK Legislation—That the Parliament agrees that the relevant provisions of the Borders, Citizenship and Immigration Bill, introduced in the House of Lords on 14 January 2009, relating to the power of detention for individuals subject to an outstanding arrest warrant and their enforcement, so far as these matters fall within the legislative competence of the Scottish Parliament, should be considered by the UK Parliament. Supported by: Fergus Ewing*

S3M-3652 Kenny MacAskill: Borders, Citizenship and Immigration Bill - UK Legislation—That the Parliament agrees that the relevant provisions of the Borders, Citizenship and Immigration Bill, introduced in the House of Lords on 14 January 2009, relating to the power of detention for individuals subject to an outstanding arrest warrant and their enforcement, so far as these matters fall within the legislative competence of the Scottish Parliament, should be considered by the UK Parliament. Supported by: Fergus Ewing
